newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish BDK bank to open Ukrainian branch.
newsitem.headline: Polish BDK bank to open Ukrainian branch.

text.p: The Polish Bank Depozytowo -Kredytowy SA (BDK) expects to receive an operating licence from the National Bank of Ukraine for its fully-owned subsidiary in the Ukraine this year, BDK's deputy president said.
Dariusz Blaszczuk told the Rzeczpospolita daily the state-owned BDK would register the subsidiary -- BDK (Ukraina) Ltd -- most likely in November.
BDK has already received permission to set up a bank from the Ukrainian central bank, he said.
"BDK's daughter company in the Ukraine is likely to be registered in November...it is likely to receive an operational licence before the end of the year," the paper quoted Blaszczuk as saying.
Blaszczuk declined to say what capital BDK's subsidiary would have or what operataions it would concentrate on.
BDK is one of the nine commercial banks created on the basis of former Polish central bank branches when market reform started in 1989.

Together with Pomorski Bank Kredytowy SA and Powszechny Bank Gospodarczy SA it forms a banking group centred around another state-owned bank Pekao SA which is to undergo consolidation and later privatisation.
